newsitem.title: USA: Boole unveils IBM management software.
newsitem.headline: Boole unveils IBM management software.

text.p: Boole & Babbage Inc on Friday unveiled a line of computer network management software for networks based on International Business Machine Corp's MQSeries standard.

The new AutoOperator for MQSeries software, designed to alert computer technicians about glitches in network operation, will meet the demand of a growing market, said Mike Bunyard, Boole & Babbage senior director of product marketing.
MQSeries is a set of technology from IBM through which mainframe computers, the storehouses of information for big companies, communicate with networks of personal computers and workstations.
Boole & Babbage said AutoOperator was available immediately at prices beginning at $18,000.
